bibl.title: Military Orders for Walter Reed, September 11, 1898

div1.p: Corbin authorizes Reed and members of his board to stop at Knoxville. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Walter Reed, September 11, 1898
div1.p:
OFFICE OF ADJUTANT GENERAL
JAN 29
307568
1900
WAR DEPARTMENT

Telegram:-
To Major Walter Reed
Surgeon U.S.A. Chicka-
mauga Park Ga, stating
that Sec'y War authorizes
him and members of his
Board to stop over at
Knoxville.

TELEGRAM.
OFFICIAL BUSINESS.
CHARGE TO ADJUTANT GENERAL'S
OFFICE--GOVERNMENT RATE.

Major Walter Reed,
Surgeon U.S.A.
Chickamauga Park, Ga.

Secretary War authorizes stop over at
Knoxville to you and members of your Board. Travel necessary
for the public service.

(sgr) H. C. Corbin
Adjutant General.
C

Sept. 22/98 sent
{ copies to --
{ Hdqrs. A.
{ S. G.
